trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of message headers for a message.
This class cannot be inherited.
A message header contains optional metadata that describe a message encapsulated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> class.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> can have zero or more headers that are used as an extension mechanism to pass information in messages that are application-specific.
You can use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message.Headers%2A> to add message headers to a message by calling the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders.Add%2A> method.
[!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] provides a number of predefined message headers:
Header Name
Description
To
Contains the role that the message is targeting.
Action
Provides a description of how the message should be processed.
FaultTo
Contains the address of the node to which faults should be sent.
From
Contains the address of the node that sent the message.
Request
Indicates whether the message is a request.
MessageID
Contains the unique ID of the message.
RelatesTo
Contains the IDs of messages that are related to this message.
ReplyTo
Contains the address of the node to which a reply should be sent for a request.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders"></xref> class with the specified collection of message headers.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders"></xref> class with the specified message version.
The SOAP version of the message.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders"></xref> class with the specified message version and size.
The SOAP version of the message.
Gets or sets a description of how the message should be processed.
This property corresponds to the <`Action`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
A description of how the message should be processed.
Adds the specified message header to the collection.
A message header to be added to the collection.
Removes all the headers from the collection.
Copies the header content located at the specified index from the specified message to this instance.
A message from which the header is copied from.
The location of the original message header, from which the content is copied over.
Copies the header content located at the specified index from the specified message header collection to this instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders"></xref> collection object.
The location of the original message header, from which the content is copied over.
Copies the content from the specified header collection to this instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders"></xref> collection object from which the headers are copied to this instance.
Copies the content of all the headers from the specified message to this instance.
A message from which the headers are copied from.
Copies the headers from this collection to an array, starting at a particular index of the array.
The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the message header objects copied from this instance.
The Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
Gets the number of message headers in this collection.
The number of message headers in this collection.
Gets or sets the address of the node to which faults should be sent.
This property corresponds to the <`FaultTo`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> of the node to which faults should be sent.
Finds a message header in this collection by the specified LocalName and namespace URI of the header element.
The LocalName of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The index of the message header in this collection if found or -1 if the header specified does not exist.
Arguments are `null`.
The header specified by the arguments exists multiple times.
Finds a message header in this collection by the specified LocalName, namespace URI and actors of the header element.
The LocalName of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The targeted recipient of the message header.
The index of the message header in this collection if found, or -1 if the header specified does not exist.
Arguments are `null`.
The header specified by the arguments exists multiple times.
Gets or sets the address of the node that sent the message.
This property corresponds to the <`From`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> of the node that sent the message.
Returns an enumerator for iterating through the collection.
This method cannot be inherited.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Retrieves a message header in this collection by the specified LocalName, namespace URI and serializer.
The LocalName of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
The type of the message header.
A message header with the specified name.
Finds a message header in this collection by the specified LocalName and namespace URI of the header element.
This method only uses the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>.
It does not try to detect from the type whether it should use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer> or the `DataContractSerializer`.

To use the XML serializer, call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders.GetHeader%60%601%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer%29> or obtain the reader at the contents and call directly into the serializer.
The LocalName of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The type of the message header.
A message header with the specified name.
Retrieves a message header in this collection by the specified LocalName, namespace URI and actors of the header element.
This method only uses the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>.
It does not try to detect from the type whether it should use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer> or `DataContractSerializer`.

To use the XML serializer, call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders.GetHeader%60%601%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer%29> or obtain the reader at the contents and call directly into the serializer.
The LocalName of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
The targeted recipient of the message header.
The type of the message header.
A message header with the specified name.
Retrieves a message header at a specific position in this collection.
This method only uses the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>.
It does not try to detect from the type whether it should use the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer> or `DataContractSerializer`.

To use the XML serializer, call <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaders.GetHeader%60%601%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer%29> or obtain the reader at the contents and call directly into the serializer.
The zero-based index of the header to get.
The type of the message header.
A message header at the specified index.
Retrieves a message header at a specific position in this collection.
The zero-based index of the header to get.
An <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.XmlObjectSerializer"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
The type of the message header.
A message header at the specified index.
Gets a XML dictionary reader that consumes the message header at the specified location of the collection.
The zero-based index of the header to get.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> object that consumes the message header at the specified location of the collection.
Verifies whether all the message headers marked with `MustUnderstand` have been properly interpreted and processed.
If the message receiver cannot interpret the message headers marked with `MustUnderstand`, the message is not processed and an exception is thrown.
`true` if the recipients specified by actors have properly interpreted and processed all the message headers marked with `MustUnderstand`; otherwise, `false`.
Verifies whether the specified recipients have properly interpreted and processed all the message headers marked with `MustUnderstand`.
If the message receiver cannot interpret the message headers marked with `MustUnderstand`, the message is not processed and an exception is thrown.
The targeted recipient of the message header.
`true` if the recipients specified by actors have properly interpreted and processed all the message headers marked with `MustUnderstand`; otherwise, `false`.
Inserts a message header into the collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index at which header should be inserted.
A message header to insert.
Retrieves a header at the given index.
The zero-based index of the header in the list.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageHeaderInfo"></xref> in the collection.
If index is greater than or equal to the number of headers in the list, this returns `null`.
Gets or sets the unique ID of the message.
This property corresponds to the <`MessageID`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
The unique ID of the message.
Gets the SOAP version of the message.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion"></xref> that is SOAP version of the message.
Gets the IDs of messages that are related to this message.
This property corresponds to the <`RelateTo`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
The IDs of messages that are related to this message.
Removes all headers with the specified name and namespace from the collection.
The LocalName of the header XML element.
The namespace URI of the header XML element.
Removes the message header at the specified index from the collection.
The zero-based index of the header to remove.
Gets or sets the address of the node to which a reply should be sent for a request.
This property corresponds to the <`ReplyTo`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> of the node to which a reply should be sent for a request.
Sets the action element of the header.
A description of how the message should be processed.
Gets or sets the destination endpoint of a message.
This property corresponds to the <`To`> element described in the [WS-Addressing specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96163).
A URI that contains the destination endpoint of a message.
Gets all the message headers that must be understood, according to SOAP 1.1/1.2 specification.
If the message receiver cannot interpret the message headers contained in this property, the message is not processed and an exception is thrown.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.UnderstoodHeaders"></xref> that represents the message headers that must be understood.
Serializes the header from the specified location using the specified XML writer.
The zero-based index of the header to be serialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
Serializes the header from the specified location using the specified XML writer.
The zero-based index of the header to be serialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header.
Serializes the specified header content using the specified XML writer.
The zero-based index of the header to be serialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header contents.
Serializes the specified header content using the specified XML writer.
The zero-based index of the header to be serialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the header contents.
Serializes the start header using the specified XML writer.
The zero-based index of the header to be serialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the start header.
Serializes the start header using the specified XML writer.
The zero-based index of the header to be serialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlWriter"></xref> that is used to serialize the start header.
Returns an enumerator for iterating through the collection.
This method cannot be inherited.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> object that can be used to iterate through the collection.
